name: Coconut and Marzipan Macaroons
author: nch
summary: These chocolate-dipped macaroons originate from the German city of Lübeck, popular for its marzipan.
ingredients: 2 (3.5 ounce) packages dark chocolate, finely chopped
directions: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
Grease a baking sheet or line with parchment paper
Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until foamy
Continue beating until stiff peaks form
Combine marzipan with 1/2 of the confectioners' sugar and rub with your fingers until mixture resembles bread crumbs
Add coconut, remaining confectioners' sugar, lemon zest, and rum
Using 2 teaspoons, drop small dollops of mixture onto the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until the macaroons are golden but soft to the touch, about 20 minutes
Transfer to a cooling rack and cool completely, 30 minutes to 1 hour
Place 3/4 of the chocolate in the top of a double boiler over simmering water
Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes
Remove from heat and stir in remaining chocolate until melted
Dip 1/3 of each cooled macaroon into the melted chocolate
Set macaroons on waxed paper until chocolate has set
Store the macaroons in an airtight container, with waxed paper between the layers
